1. STORM FRONT, by John Sandford. 
The Minnesota investigator Virgil Flowers becomes involved in the hunt for an ancient inscribed stone smuggled out of the Middle East.

2. DOING HARD TIME, by Stuart Woods.

5. THE LONGEST RIDE, by Nicholas Sparks. 
The lives of two couples converge unexpectedly.

6. GONE, by James Patterson and Michael Ledwidge. 
Detective Michael Bennett, living with his 10 adopted children on a California farm, is pursued by the head of a Mexican drug cartel he once put in jail. 

7. STARRY NIGHT, by Debbie Macomber. 
At Christmastime, a big-city columnist sets out to interview a reclusive author in Alaska.

8. ENDER'S GAME, by Orson Scott Card. 
Government agencies breed child geniuses and train them as soldiers. Originally published in 1985.

9. GONE GIRL, by Gillian Flynn. 
A woman disappears on the day of her fifth anniversary; is her husband a killer?	

10. NEVER GO BACK, by Lee Child.
Jack Reacher is thrown into jail on trumped-up charges and must clear his name.

11. THE CIRCLE, by Dave Eggers. 
A dystopian novel about life on the campus of a powerful Internet company.

12. WORTH THE FIGHT, by Vi Keeland. 
A hard-bodied mixed martial arts fighter and a steady lawyer have a lot more in common than they bargained for.

13. THE RACKETEER, by John Grisham. 
An imprisoned ex-lawyer schemes to exchange information about who murdered a judge for his freedom.
